intro: Boehmeria coriacea, commonly known as roughleaf nettle, is a flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including China, Japan, and India. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
